title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http:contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: Introduction to the helminthR package
text: GitHub CRAN

title: Introduction to the helminthR package
text: package allows acquisition host-helminth interaction records based host name (genus species), parasite name (genus, species, group), /location (accepted region name provided data(locations). Parasite groups include “Acanthocephalans”, “Cestodes”, “Monogeans”, “Nematodes”, “Trematodes”, “Turbs” (short Turbellarians). user can define host species occuring “wild” “Zoo captivity” “Domesticated” “Experimental” “Commercial source” “Accidental infestation” inputting corresponding number hostState argument. package three main functions; findHost, findParasite, findLocation.

what: Find all helminth parasites of a given host species
title: Introduction to the helminthR package
text: Given host genus (optionally) species location, function returns host-parasite associations given host species. example determines parasite records helminth infections Gorilla gorilla. also use citation argument obtain information citations host-helminth occurrences based . function query database helminth parasites Gorilla gorilla captured wild, remove helminth parasites identified species. user wishes query multiple host species time, user can following
code: gorillaParasites <- findHost(genus='Gorilla', species='gorilla',      hostState=1, speciesOnly=TRUE, citation=TRUE) hosts <- c('Gorilla gorilla', 'Peromyscus leucopus') plyr::ldply(hosts,      function(x){         findHost(unlist(strsplit(x, ' '))[1],              unlist(strsplit(x,' '))[2])     } )

what: Find all hosts of a given helminth parasite
title: Introduction to the helminthR package
text: Given helminth parasite genus (optionally species, location), function returns list host-parasite records parasite. example , query database occurrences genus Strongyloides.

title: Introduction to the helminthR package
text: data file containing location names can queried, along putative latitude longitude coordinates centroid location can found data(locations). Note replace object global environment named locations. names can given findLocation() function, finds host-parasite associations occurred given location. , look host-parasite associations recorded France.

title: Introduction to the helminthR package
text: , provide example code plotting bipartite network host-helminth interactions found state Montana.
code: g <- igraph::graph.incidence(table(montanaOcc[,1:2])) igraph::V(g)$name <- NA igraph::E(g)$color <- 'black'  plot(g,      vertex.color=c("black","dodgerblue")[igraph::V(g)$type+1],     vertex.size=5 )

what: Clean helminth parasite occurrence data — cleanData
title: Clean helminth parasite occurrence data — cleanData
text: Given host-parasite edgelist, function can validate species names, provide taxonomic information (thanks taxize),  remove records genus level.

title: Clean helminth parasite occurrence data — cleanData
Clean helminth parasite occurrence data — cleanData
text: edge Host-parasite edgelist obtained findLocation, findHost, findParasite speciesOnly boolean flag remove host parasite species data available genus level (default = FALSE) validateHosts boolean flag check host species names Catalogue Life information output taxonomic information (default = FALSE)

title: Clean helminth parasite occurrence data — cleanData
text: cleanEdge Host-parasite edgelist, cleaned

what: Find parasite occurrence data for given host. — findHost
title: Find parasite occurrence data for given host. — findHost
text: Given host genus, species, /location, returns list parasite occurrences host location.  Use data(locations) list possible locations.

title: Find parasite occurrence data for given host. — findHost
code: findHost(   genus = NULL,   species = NULL,   location = NULL,   citation = FALSE,   hostState = NULL,   speciesOnly = FALSE,   validateHosts = FALSE,   parGroup = NULL,   removeDuplicates = FALSE )

title: Find parasite occurrence data for given host. — findHost
text: genus Host genus species Host species location Geographic location. citation Boolean. output include citation link  number supporting citations? default FALSE hostState number corresponding one six different host states.  default value NULL includes host states speciesOnly boolean flag remove host parasite species data available genus level (default = FALSE) validateHosts boolean flag check host species names Catalogue Life information output taxonomic information (default = FALSE) parGroup name parasite group query (default queries groups) removeDuplicates (boolean) duplicate host-parasite  combinations removed? (default FALSE)

title: Find parasite occurrence data for given host. — findHost
text: Three (five) column data.frame containing host species,  	parasite species (shortened name full name), citation link  	number citations (`citation`=TRUE), row corresponding  	occurrence parasite species host species.

title: Find parasite occurrence data for given host. — findHost
text: hostState can take values 1-6 corresponding recorded host  	found (1) "wild" (2) "Zoo captivity" (3) "Domesticated" (4) "Experimental" (5) "Commercial source" (6) "Accidental infestation" value NULL entered like include  	hostStates. parGroup can specified "Acanthocephalans", "Cestodes", 	"Monogeans", "Nematodes", "Trematodes", "Turbs" (Turbellarians etc.).  	default query helminth parasite taxa.

title: Find parasite occurrence data for given host. — findHost
text: Gibson, D. ., Bray, R. ., & Harris, E. . (Compilers) (2005). Host-Parasite Database Natural History Museum, London. <http://www.nhm.ac.uk/research-curation/scientific-resources/taxonomy-systematics/host-parasites/>

what: Find host-parasite interactions for a given location — findLocation
title: Find host-parasite interactions for a given location — findLocation
text: Given location (available data{locations}) function  returns host-parasite associations location.

title: Find host-parasite interactions for a given location — findLocation
code: findLocation(   location = NULL,   group = NULL,   citation = FALSE,   hostState = NULL,   speciesOnly = FALSE,   validateHosts = FALSE,   removeDuplicates = FALSE )

title: Find host-parasite interactions for a given location — findLocation
text: location Location host-parasite interaction. group Parasite group - Cestodes, Acanthocephalans, Monogeneans,  Nematodes, Trematodes, Turbellarian etc. (Turb) citation Boolean. output include citation link  number supporting citations? default FALSE hostState number corresponding one six different host states.  default value NULL includes host states. speciesOnly boolean flag remove host parasite species data available genus level (default = FALSE) validateHosts boolean flag check host species names Catalogue Life information output taxonomic information (default = FALSE) removeDuplicates (boolean) duplicate host-parasite  combinations removed? (default FALSE)

title: Find host-parasite interactions for a given location — findLocation
text: Three (five) column data.frame containing host species,  	parasite species (shortened name full name), citation link  	number citations (citation = TRUE), row corresponding  	occurrence parasite species host species.

title: Find host-parasite interactions for a given location — findLocation
text: hostState can take values 1-6 corresponding recorded  host found (1) "wild" (2) "Zoo captivity" (3) "Domesticated" (4) "Experimental" (5) "Commercial source" (6) "Accidental infestation"

title: Find host-parasite interactions for a given location — findLocation
text: Gibson, D. ., Bray, R. ., & Harris, E. . (Compilers) (2005). Host-Parasite Database Natural History Museum, London. <http://www.nhm.ac.uk/research-curation/scientific-resources/taxonomy-systematics/host-parasites/>

title: Find host-parasite interactions for a given location — findLocation
text: Tad Dallas

title: Find host-parasite interactions for a given location — findLocation

what: Find host-parasite interactions for a given parasite species. — findParasite
title: Find host-parasite interactions for a given parasite species. — findParasite
text: Given host genus /species, function returns matrix containing host-parasite interaction data. Search available locations using  data(locations).

title: Find host-parasite interactions for a given parasite species. — findParasite
code: findParasite(   genus = NULL,   species = NULL,   group = NULL,   subgroup = NULL,   location = NULL,   citation = FALSE,   hostState = NULL,   speciesOnly = FALSE,   validateHosts = FALSE,   removeDuplicates = FALSE )

title: Find host-parasite interactions for a given parasite species. — findParasite
text: genus Parasite genus species Parasite species group Parasite group - Cestodes, Acanthocephalans, Monogeneans,  Nematodes, Trematodes, Turbellarian etc. (Turb) subgroup Parasite subgroup (family names largely) location Location host-parasite interaction. citation Boolean. output include citation link  number supporting citations? default FALSE hostState number corresponding one six different host states.  default value NULL      includes host states speciesOnly boolean flag remove host parasite species data available genus level (default = FALSE) validateHosts boolean flag check host species names Catalogue Life information output taxonomic information (default = FALSE) removeDuplicates (boolean) duplicate host-parasite  combinations removed? (default FALSE)

title: Find host-parasite interactions for a given parasite species. — findParasite
text: Three (five) column data.frame containing host species,    parasite species (shortened name full name), citation link    number citations (citation = TRUE), row corresponding    occurrence parasite species host species.

title: Find host-parasite interactions for a given parasite species. — findParasite
text: hostState can take values 1-6 corresponding recorded host  found (1) "wild" (2) "Zoo captivity" (3) "Domesticated" (4) "Experimental" (5) "Commercial source" (6) "Accidental infestation"

title: Find host-parasite interactions for a given parasite species. — findParasite
text: Gibson, D. ., Bray, R. ., & Harris, E. . (Compilers) (2005). Host-Parasite Database Natural History Museum, London.  <http://www.nhm.ac.uk/research-curation/scientific-resources/taxonomy-systematics/host-parasites/>

title: Find host-parasite interactions for a given parasite species. — findParasite
text: Tad Dallas

title: Find host-parasite interactions for a given parasite species. — findParasite
code: strongHosts <- helminthR::findParasite(genus = "Strongyloides")  # An example of how to query multiple parasite species when  # you have a vector of parasite species names  parasites <- c("Ascaris aculeati", "Oxyuris flagellum") # \donttest{  plyr::ldply(parasites,     function(x){      helminthR::findParasite(unlist(strsplit(x, " "))[1],         unlist(strsplit(x," "))[2])    }  ) #>                     Host          Parasite                      ParasiteFull #> 1 Gasterosteus aculeatus  Ascaris aculeati    Ascaris aculeati Linstow, 1884 #> 2       Procavia syriaca Oxyuris flagellum Oxyuris flagellum Ehrenberg, 1828 # }

what: Access London Natural History Museum host-helminth record database — helminthR-package
title: Access London Natural History Museum host-helminth record database — helminthR-package
text: 'helminthR': programmatic interface London    Natural History Museum's host-parasite database. package currently allows query host species, parasite species,  geographic location. information provided parasite prevalence intensity.

text: Gibson, D. ., Bray, R. ., & Harris, E. . (Compilers) (2005). Host-Parasite Database Natural History Museum, London.  <http://www.nhm.ac.uk/research-curation/scientific-resources/taxonomy-systematics/host-parasites/>

title: Access London Natural History Museum host-helminth record database — helminthR-package
text: Tad Dallas tad..dallas@gmail.com

what: Table of geographic location names, and associated coordinates — locations
title: Table of geographic location names, and associated coordinates — locations
text: Lists geographic locations can input findHost findParasite corresponding latitude longitude coordinates  country's centroid. georeferencing performed dynamically using  Google Maps API, since restricted access. data locations now provided data file called locations -- data(locations) -- based  earlier usage ggmap. geographic coordinates may accurate, users check accuracy (feel free file issue PR Github corrections).

Table of geographic location names, and associated coordinates — locations
text: Location Name geographic location Latitude Latitude location centroid Longitude Longitude location centroid

title: helminthR 1.0.10
text: CRAN release: 2022-12-08 Tiny bug fix making sure error gracefully web resource unavailable. Mainly affected vignette, additional code added findParasite, findHost, findLocation error handling.

title: helminthR 1.0.9
text: CRAN release: 2021-08-16 Fixing NOTES WARNINGS vignette creation process package. Switched Travis CI GitHub Actions CI GitHub.

title: helminthR 1.0.8
text: CRAN release: 2021-02-16 Small fix cleanData function now use taxize get host species taxonomic data.

title: helminthR 1.0.7
text: CRAN release: 2019-02-03 Removed geocoding functionality previously present listLocations(), now requires API key. cached version geographic coordinates locations provided package data (data(locations)). Added extra catch cleanDat.R remove species identified “something spp.” instead just removing identified “something sp.”.

title: helminthR 1.0.6
text: CRAN release: 2018-08-15 bug fix causing null results location specifications.

title: helminthR 1.0.5
text: CRAN release: 2018-07-30 Released CRAN.
